text:
ATLANTA, 2028.

The humidity hits you first - thick and sweet. You're in a repurposed warehouse in Cabbagetown. To your left, a server rack humming with your proprietary audio-spatialization code. To your right, a recording booth where 'The Geometrics' are tuning up.

Your partner, Marcus, looks at you. 'We can optimize the streaming algorithm to save bandwidth, or we can push the fidelity to rival the analog masters. What's the move?'

Six months later. The platform, 'Resonance', is live. UMG has noticed. They offer a buyout - enough cash to never work again, but they want to dismantle the artist-ownership model you built.

Marcus is torn. 'They'll crush us if we say no. But if we say yes, we're just another cog.'

choices.text: Refuse and Fight (Build the new system)
Take the Deal and infiltrate (Strategic pivot)

text:
The decision echoes in the warehouse silence. You realize that whether you fight from the outside or the inside, the music hasn't stopped. It's just a different tempo now.

The warehouse fades. The hum of servers turns into the click-clack of the mechanical departure board...

NORTH SEA, 150 METERS DOWN.

The silence is total. Just the rhythm of your own breath in the rebreather. You're welding a structural fissure on the Piper Alpha rig legs. The pressure is immense - 16 atmospheres crushing in from all sides.

Your HUD flashes a warning: 'Oxygen mix imbalance. CO2 scrubbing at 85%.' It's workable, but risky.

choices.text: Stay and Finish the Weld (The Job Matters)

text: You hold your line. The arc torch lights up the murky water like a supernova. Suddenly, the current shifts. A piece of debris slams into your tether, pinning you against the pylon. You can't move your arm to free it.

choices.text: Slow your breathing. Calculate the leverage. (Focus)

text:
With slow, deliberate movements, you twist the carabiner. Click. You drift free. The darkness of the ocean feels less like a threat and more like a blanket now. You've mastered the pressure.

The water fades. The hiss of the rebreather becomes the steam of a train engine arriving...
